verses.verse: A false<WH4820> balance<WH3976> is abomination<WH8441> to the Lord<WH3068>: but a just<WH8003> weight<WH68> is his delight<WH7522>.
When pride<WH2087> comes<WH935>, then comes<WH935> shame<WH7036>: but with the lowly<WH6800> is wisdom<WH2451>.
The integrity<WH8538> of the upright<WH3477> shall guide<WH5148> them<WH5558>: but the perverseness of transgressors<WH898> shall destroy them<WH7703>.
Riches<WH1952> profit<WH3276> not in the day<WH3117> of wrath<WH5678>: but righteousness<WH6666> delivers<WH5337> from death<WH4194>.
The righteousness<WH6666> of the perfect<WH8549> shall direct<WH3474> his way<WH1870>: but the wicked<WH7563> shall fall<WH5307> by his own wickedness<WH7564>.
The righteousness<WH6666> of the upright<WH3477> shall deliver<WH5337> them<WH898>: but transgressors shall be taken<WH3920> in their own naughtiness<WH1942>.
When a wicked<WH7563> man<WH120> dies<WH4194>, his expectation<WH8615> shall perish<WH6>: and the hope<WH8431> of unjust<WH205> men perishes<WH6>.
The righteous<WH6662> is delivered out<WH2502> of trouble<WH6869>, and the wicked<WH7563> comes in his place<WH935>.
An hypocrite<WH2611> with his mouth<WH6310> destroys<WH7843> his neighbor<WH7453>: but through knowledge<WH1847> shall the just<WH6662> be delivered<WH2502>.
When it goes well<WH2898> with the righteous<WH6662>, the city<WH7151> rejoices<WH5970>: and when the wicked<WH7563> perish<WH6>, there are shouts of joy<WH7440>.
By the blessing<WH1293> of the upright<WH3477> the city<WH7176> is exalted<WH7311>: but it is overthrown<WH2040> by the mouth<WH6310> of the wicked<WH7563>.
He that is void<WH2638> of wisdom<WH3820> despises<WH936> his neighbor<WH7453>: but a man<WH376> of understanding<WH8394> holds his peace<WH2790>.
A talebearer<WH1980> reveals<WH1540> secrets<WH5475>: but he that is of a faithful<WH539> spirit<WH7307> conceals<WH3680> the matter<WH1697>.
Where no counsel<WH8458> is<WH5971>, the people fall<WH5307>: but in the multitude<WH7230> of counselors<WH3289> there is safety<WH8668>.
He that is collateral<WH6148> for a stranger<WH2114> shall smart<WH7321> for it<WH8130>: and he that refuses collateral<WH8628> is secure<WH982>.
A gracious<WH2580> woman<WH802> retains<WH8551> honor<WH3519>: and strong<WH6184> men retain<WH8551> riches<WH6239>.
The merciful<WH2617> man<WH376> does good<WH1580> to his own soul<WH5315>: but he that is cruel<WH394> troubles<WH5916> his own flesh<WH7607>.
The wicked<WH7563> works<WH6213> a deceitful<WH8267> work<WH6468>: but to him that sows<WH2232> righteousness<WH6666> there shall be a sure<WH571> reward<WH7938>.
As righteousness<WH6666> tends to life<WH2416>: so he that pursues<WH7291> evil<WH7451> pursues it to his own death<WH4194>.
They that are of a perverse<WH6141> heart<WH3820> are abomination<WH8441> to the Lord<WH3068>: but such as are upright<WH8549> in their way<WH1870> are his delight<WH7522>.
Though hand<WH3027> join in hand<WH3027>, the wicked<WH7451> shall not be unpunished<WH5352>: but the seed<WH2233> of the righteous<WH6662> shall be delivered<WH4422>.
As a jewel<WH5141> of gold<WH2091> in a swine<WH2386>'s snout<WH639>, so is a fair<WH3303> woman<WH802> which is without<WH5493> discretion<WH2940>.
The desire<WH8378> of the righteous<WH6662> is only good<WH2896>: but the expectation<WH8615> of the wicked<WH7563> is wrath<WH5678>.
There is<WH3426> that scatters<WH6340>, and yet increases<WH3254>; and there is that withholds<WH2820> more than is meet<WH3476>, but it tends to poverty<WH4270>.
The liberal<WH1293> soul<WH5315> shall be made fat<WH1878>: and he that waters<WH7301> shall be watered also himself<WH3384>.
He that withholds<WH4513> corn<WH1250>, the people<WH3816> shall curse<WH5344> him<WH1293>: but blessing shall be upon the head<WH7218> of him that sells it<WH7666>.
He that diligently seeks<WH7836> good<WH2896> procures<WH1245> favor<WH7522>: but he that seeks<WH1875> mischief<WH7451>, it shall come unto him<WH935>.
He that trusts<WH982> in his riches<WH6239> shall fall<WH5307>: but the righteous<WH6662> shall flourish<WH6524> as a branch<WH5929>.
He that troubles<WH5916> his own house<WH1004> shall inherit<WH5157> the wind<WH7307>: and the fool<WH191> shall be servant<WH5650> to the wise<WH2450> of heart<WH3820>.
The fruit<WH6529> of the righteous<WH6662> is a tree<WH6086> of life<WH2416>; and he that wins<WH3947> souls<WH5315> is wise<WH2450>.
Behold<WH6662>, the righteous shall be recompensed<WH7999> in the earth<WH776>: much more the wicked<WH7563> and the sinner<WH2398>.
